Job Title: Associate Director, Professional Services - Post Acute Care

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology, Sales

Description:
For more than 20 years, PointClickCare has been the backbone of senior care. We’ve amassed the richest senior care dataset making our market density untouchable and our connections to the healthcare ecosystem exponentially more powerful than those of any other platform.

With Collective Medical & Audacious Inquiry, we’ve become the most expansive, full-continuum care collaboration network, offering care teams immediate, point-of-care access to deep, real-time insights at every stage of a patient’s journey.

For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.

The Associate Director for Post-Acute Care is a key leader in our organization who is responsible for engaging with customers to understand their desired outcomes and provide recommendations on workflow and adoption of our solutions. The ideal candidate has extensive clinical and operational management experience in multiple care settings including acute and post-acute care such as home health care, hospice, skilled nursing facilities and inpatient rehabilitation. The Associate Director for Post-Acute Care also has expertise in designing and executing post-acute network strategy and alignment with alternative payment models, such as bundling, ACOs, and DCEs. To be effective, our customers and prospective clients may need to adopt new technology and workflows. As the Associate Director for Post-Acute Care, you will bring to bear a thorough understanding of all PointClickCare resources to support value creation and a user’s ability to hold themselves accountable to the rigors of an alternative payment model. Additionally, the Associate Director for Post-Acute Care can assess and optimize transitions of care, care coordination, readmission reduction, and discharge planning across the continuum of care. If you are passionate about improving the quality and efficiency of post-acute care delivery, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

Evaluate customer data, workflows, and goals to offer tailored recommendations to build scalable processes.Educate others within the organization by offering resource support and onboarding on best practice post-acute care models, in order to help our customers improve outcomes and drive value.Through direct relationships, conferences, and analysis of market activity, develop and maintain deep understanding of our customers, their pain points, use cases, and clinical workflows; support efforts to scale this knowledge across internal teams and PCC’s customers through ad hoc and regular updates.Working with Senior Care, Product and Product Marketing, provide strategic insights for our product team to help guide innovation in our solutions.Provide thought leadership as a keynote speaker at our Care Collaboration Conferences.Stay abreast of relevant regulations and policies related to post-acute care management and value-based care to help ensure organizational compliance.Helping to champion the intersection of senior care and the acute and health plan space. Guiding customers to see the value created from cross divisional adoption of solutions.

Qualifications & Skills

Deep domain expertise and at least 3 years direct experience with the clinical, financial, and quality infrastructure and needs of the post-acute industry (include risk-bearing entities, like ACOs and health plans, or senior living, skilled nursing facilities). Preference: 3-5 years' experience in either an acute, post-acute setting, or with a health plan.Experience in negotiating provider reimbursement. Preference: Experience in drafting actual VBC arrangements.Bachelor's degree in a healthcare related field. Preference :Master's degree in a healthcare related field.Strong analytical, data, financial, leadership and communication skills.Strong critical and creative thinking and problem solving skills.

It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.

When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team: recruitment@pointclickcare.com

PointClickCare is committed to Information Security. By applying to this position, if hired, you commit to following our information security policies and procedures and making every effort to secure confidential and/or sensitive information.

At PointClickCare, base salary is one of the many components that make up our total rewards package. The US base salary range for this position is $151,000 - $176,500 + bonus or commission + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by job and level. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual compensation is determined by job-related skills and knowledge, relevant experience including professional and lived experience, and/or work location. Your recruiter can share more information about our total rewards package during the hiring process.

Experience Level (if available): Director
